Description: Object carved from soft whitish imestone in the shape of a rectanguar base, broken at one end, on which rest three rectanguar buging 'cushions'; on the very top, in low reief, an obong object. Traces of red paint at junction between tip and middle cushion and on top of top cushion, and of green paint at junction between base and first cushion. Accessory to serving statuette/ altar?
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
pencil mark on underside "9" = number of object in inventory of stone objects sent by EEF to Boston. From an ithyphallic Harpocrates figurine?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CE.209) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
